newsitem.title: MEXICO: Sidek says listed on New York OTC market.
newsitem.headline: Sidek says listed on New York OTC market.

text.p: Mexico's Grupo Sidek SA de CV on Tuesday said it had secured a listing on New York's over-the-counter (OTC) market after its American Depositary Receipts were delisted by the New York Stock Exchange.
Sidek said its OTC listing went into effect on March 21, with Bancomer and Mexican development bank Nacional Financiera acting as custodian banks.
The stock's CUSIP identification numbers remain the same. Over-the-counter issues will trade at a ratio of one to four peso-denominated shares.
Sidek L shares are now listed under the ticker "GPSAY," and its B shares are now listed under the ticker "GPSBY."
Dealers consulted by Reuters said neither bids nor offers had been placed for Sidek stock in New York.
The Sidek group has experienced debt problems since an abrupt devaluation of the peso in December 1994.
Sidek's main interests are steelmaking, through its Simec subsidiary, and tourism, through subsidiary Situr.
